intro: Selinum ibericum, commonly known as the Iberian wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Due to its aromatic properties and historical use in herbal medicine, it is of interest to botanists and traditional healers alike.
